divs: sighting detailsi stepped outside at 2220 (+\-2 mins) for a cigarette. as soon as i did i noticed 2 large orange lights in the sky, i'd estimate around 2,000-5,000ft altitude maximum travelling at high speed from my 1 o'clock to over my left shoulder. the 2 lights could have been joined (the lights appeared to 'reach' towards each other more than they radiated in other directions) so could have been one object - they were certainly either in strict formation or joined. lights were approximately the size of the full moon (so big, noticeable) and the most noticeable thing about them was the distortion apparent, like nothing i've ever seen; imagine sort of the pixellisation mtv etc use to hide brand logos, blocky\blurry effect constantly changing over the lights, introducing black 'patches'. the lights travelled in a constant curved path overhead, speed difficult to estimate but certainly faster than helicopters which sometimes fly over so not lanterns, no other lights so not aircraft flying in accordance with regs. no change in velocity or direction (ballistic trajectory). i first thought they were meteorites as that would explain the speed and trajectory (and parallel paths) but given the size, speed and altitude they'd have made one hell of a mess when they hit and having seen fast jets before these looked supersonic, but made no noise. they passed over the roof of my house and out of sight. it happened very fast but the distortion (not visible anywhere else in the sky, or in the region they traversed before\after they did) spooked me slightly as it was very, very weird - like a visual camouflage almost. nothing like heat haze. colour was very similar to sodium streetlights. i've thought and thought about it but other than a pair of identically-sized meteorites travelling silently, low and fast there's not much that could explain this. not aircraft due to lack of running lights and noise, not lanterns or rockets due to the distortion effect and speed. stone cold sober, wearing my glasses, familiar with everything normally seen in the sky (heathrow flight path overhead - but much, much higher). looking at the mufon records there's a hell of a lot of orange things in the skies over britain, but none that i've found have this "fuzzy" appearance, speed or size. i now keep my slr by my back door :d
Summary: Pair of blurry/pixellated orange orbs or lights, large, fast, low, silent,
trends: There have been 91 other sightings in London
There were no other sightings in London on or around August 17th 2009
